instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [solved]Problems with <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> MAcbook Air after liquid spill mid2014
threads.message:
hello friends,

i got an macbook air with an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B board.

the machine dont turned on, no green light nothing.

after ultrasonic clean, machine is working with an intresting aspect.

if i start up holding donwn the alt key to select the start srive i get a nice long dong :-)

the drives appears, mouse and keyboard working

I select an USB hdd or an USB stick with OSX installation, everything ist starting up

but then if apears the mouse pointer (for example to select user) its not possible to move the mouse or to use the keyboard.

BUT if I select the intern SSD and start up from there then in the screen where to select user everything is working mouse and keyboard.

???????

need help please. I want to run ASD but ASD 3S158 and 3S162 is not supporting that machine.

threads.title: [solved]Problems with <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> MAcbook Air after liquid spill mid2014
[solved]Problems with <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> MAcbook Air after liquid spill mid2014
[solved]Problems with <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> MAcbook Air after liquid spill mid2014
threads.message: First try a know good trackpad and cable and check the connector on the board for crap. You need 3S156.

threads.title: [solved]Problems with <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> MAcbook Air after liquid spill mid2014
threads.message:
thanks for help.

I tryed the board in another case, there is working everything fine. Then I put the board back in the original case and now here is working fine as well.

hmm. So i think the cable was not good connected like it should be. the connector i checked under the microskope, there is everything clean.

I am going now to test all with 3S156, thanks for that idea.

threads.title: [solved]Problems with <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> MAcbook Air after liquid spill mid2014
threads.message:
3S156 working good. the problem with keyboard and mouse is gone. I think it was the cable not good pluged in.
thanks for your help.
